Jinnō Shōtōki. p. 195-196. ==Events of the Chōkyū era== * 1040 (Chōkyū 1, 1st day of the 1st month): a partial eclipse of the sun, predicted for midday, occurred in mid-afternoon, causing complaints about the astronomers' failure to be more accurate.Monumenta Nipponica, Vol. 59, p. 399. * 1040 (Chōkyū 1, 9th month): The Sacred Mirror was burned in a fire.Ackroyd, Joyce. (1982). Lessons from History: the Tokushi Yoron, p. 29. * 1041 (Chōkyū 2): The Sanjo Palace burned; and it was reconstructed.Hvass, Svend M. (1999).
